attributes.action: Extortionate TV charges for hospital patients to be stopped. Free TV in hospital
attributes.background: Ill patients are being charged extortionate prices for TV while in hospital. An example of this an 77 year old with learning disabilities who has been in hospital for two wks has been charged over 100 pounds to watch TV. They can not read a book or play on their Ipad due to being illiterate.
attributes.additional_details:
What is this doing to their mental health and wellbeing? 
How is it fair to charge someone who is ill and on a low income 10 pound a day to watch TV. 
There are so many elderly patients waiting to be able to go home but can't until they are assessed and a care plan has been put in place. This can take months. Mental health becomes effected and the risk of catching something else could cause a longer stay in hospital. Please sign to help make hospital TV free.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public&private holiday services to be under an ombudsman
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for providers of holidays whether it be a public or private service,to be under an ombudsman. This allows there to be a fair and impartial assessment of dispute cases to stop those acting independently from treating customers unfairly when they are not willing to negotiate.

attributes.action: Compulsory liability insurance for dog owners, criminal offence to leave scene
attributes.background:
It is law if you damage someone's property they are entitled to compensation. 
If my dog is attacked by another dog then it's owner should pay my vet bills. It should be a criminal offence for them not to give their details. The incident/history should then be reported/recorded to authorities/vets.
attributes.additional_details:
Records of how many times dog has attacked. The owner should be made to take dog to behavioural or correction training or the dog would need to be controlled on lead or muzzled in public. 
Medical insurance should be owners choice but insurance to cover your dog attacking another dog/person compulsory. It protects both parties from expensive vet/claim costs. 
We have compulsory car insurance. Dogs feel pain, trauma and so does the owner seeing their pet attacked.
Please support.

attributes.action: Convicted terrorists should be jailed in special prisons for whole of life
attributes.background: Terrorists aim to kill. When they have been caught and prosecuted they should never have another opportunity to kill. They spread their ideology in prison increasing risk to public when they and others are released. They must be held in special prisons and kept there until they die.

attributes.action: Consider extenuating circumstances when determining maximum uni maintenance loan
attributes.background: University maintenance costs are expensive. Whilst loans are allocated according to household income, this policy assumes that parents are willing to help out their child with payments - something not all parents are willing to do, preventing students from doing well in or even attending university.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to allow for students in such situations to appeal for a greater maintenance loan. It is considered unfair that students wanting to carry on their education should be held back due to their financial backgrounds, and I would argue that this too is affected by the willingness of parents to support their children. Everyone wanting to go to university should be given the opportunity to do so, and this includes maximising support for students who will struggle with living costs!

attributes.action: Introduce prostate cancer screening
attributes.background: There are often no symptoms of prostate cancer until it has spread and its too late to cure. Many lives could be saved and it would save the NHS a fortune in expensive treatments.

attributes.action: Make crossing patrols mandatory outside schools and consistency in policing area
attributes.background: Recently we as parents have been worried about the kids crossing a main road with no patrol. Although these services are not mandatory they should be. Children can not see over the parked cars outside of schools, this then heightens the risk for children crossing the road. Consistency
attributes.additional_details: This is an issue all over in many schools and it’s down to parents really. Many parents of running late or whatever reason seem to think the yellow zigzag lines are drop off or pick up points, when in fact they are putting other children in danger. Its Time to clampdown and do something about it.we need to solve the issue make these areas mandatory to have a crossing whether it be a pelican, zebra crossing or a crossing patrol. Something needs done. More than just a fine as it’s not preventing this

attributes.action: Make the waiting lists for NHS gender identity clinics shorter
attributes.background: I’m a trans young person with mental health difficulties & I’m currently on a 2 year waiting list for a gender identity clinic. I feel like this waiting time is detrimental to my mental health difficulties & the long waiting time isn’t fair on myself or other trans people experiencing the same thing
attributes.additional_details: Long waiting times for specialist treatment can not only cause someone with gender dysphoria to go downhill, but it can be so frustrating and upsetting for trans people and their families. It takes a lot of courage to come out as trans and the long waiting times make us feel unimportant. Feeling as if you’re in the wrong body and being so desperate to change is really challenging and I feel like we should be able access support sooner.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for immigration to the UK like Australia based on work skills
attributes.background: To enter Austrailia to live you must apply and are considered based on the contribution you can make to the country. Each applicant should be able and expected to work and priority is given to applicants who are qualified in emplyment areas which we are lacking applicants

attributes.action: NHS need to invest more money in Adult Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals
attributes.additional_details: The NHS do not provide adequate staff and there are very few things to do on Adult Psychiatric wards. Staff need to be trained properly to deal with situations they do not know how to. There needs to be more distractions and activities to do and more staffing to ensure there are people to talk to when needed.

attributes.action: Refund Road Fund License for 4x4 Vehicles
attributes.background: Make a provision for 4x4 Vehicle Owners to obtain a refund against their Road Fund License where they have Volunteered their time, Vehicle and resources during the recent weather crisis
attributes.additional_details:
Over the last week, most of the UK has been battered by winter storms which have left thousands of people stranded, and thousands of essential workers unable to do their jobs. 

Ordinary people. Care workers, School teachers, NHS staff, shop workers, delivery drivers...Thousands of people. 

Into this mess have stepped hundreds if not thousands of 4x4 drivers who have freely given their time to venture out in the worst of the weather to rescue those stranded. 

This army of 4x4 drivers has kept so much of this country moving in the last week, do you think it out of place for a very public “Thank You” from the government?

attributes.action: Reverse the government plans to remove women's refuges from the welfare system.
attributes.background: Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid, said: “The government’s proposed reforms to supported housing will dismantle our national network of lifesaving refuges and put the lives of women and children trying to escape domestic abuse at risk. This is a matter of life or death.”
attributes.additional_details:
Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid told the Guardian

 “If pursued, the reforms will result in a postcode lottery of domestic abuse support services, with ... refuges being forced to close their doors and more women and children being turned away from the lifesaving support they offer,” she said.

The reforms fly in the face of pledges made by the prime minister to make it a key personal priority to transform the way the UK tackles domestic violence.

attributes.action: Change the legal driving age to 16
attributes.background: At 16, you can get married and have children, drive a motor bike but you can’t drive a car, this is unfair.

attributes.action: Give all National Health workers free parking and free public transport.
attributes.background: for the last seven years National Health workers have had a pay freeze. But are still expected to pay parking fees to park at work which can be anything up to 10% of their wages, by giving them all free parking and free public transport.This would be like giving them a 5-6% pay rise

attributes.action: Ban low letterboxes in UK on new build
attributes.background: I would like to see the UK Government amend building regulations & ban low letterboxes as has been the case in Ireland Since January 1st 2001
attributes.additional_details:
Letter  boxes should be postman friendly..Low boxes can cause serious injury when you have quite a few in a row or on a round whilst carrying a sack of mail.
 Even just one low letterbox is one too many.. You wouldn't put the keyhole down there so why put the letterbox down there.

attributes.action: Award World War 2 Veterans a medal
attributes.background: We the undersigned request that HM Government issue a medal or other symbol of recognition to World War 2 Veterans on the 75th Anniversary of the ending of World War 2 in 2020.

attributes.action: Ban LED vehicle headlights
attributes.background: These new LED headlights are horrendous for drivers with any kind of light sensitivity, and probably not great for anyone. I literally put my hand in front of my eyes when a car with these lights approach. Instinctive reflex to protect my eyes, highly dangerous when driving!  Normal headlights fine.

attributes.action: Make sure every disabled toilet uses the radar key.Ban selling radar keys online
attributes.background: Not all disabled toilets have a radar lock so I couldn't use my radar key. Most disabled people carry a radar key to make them independent. Also, did you know that anyone can buy a radar key online? It's defeating the purpose of it. It should be only available to disabled people.

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for buses to carry standing children on the motorway.
attributes.background: There is an anomoly in the law in that children are required to use car seats until the age of 12 and everyone must wear seatbelts in vehicles save for a few exceptions, yet apparently double decker buses can be licensed to carry up to 30 standing passengers on the motorway even if they are children
attributes.additional_details: My child uses a double decker school bus which has to travel on the motorway to avoid a low bridge. There are insufficient seats for the children so there are always children standing. I have raised this with various Govt agencies and Bus Users UK advised that buses can be licensed to carry up to 30 children standing because of economics. Even if they change the route to rectify our situation it seems insane that any child in the UK could be placed at risk in this manner on our busy motorways.

attributes.action: Set the National living wage for all who work not just 25
attributes.background: Help more people into work and a fair pay living wage

attributes.action: For the campaign #askforangela to be a government backed national roll out
attributes.background: A simple code-word campaign for people feeling unsafe on a date. It encourages people to discreetly ask for help by going to the bar and ' Ask for Angela' - a phrase aimed at alerting bar staff to the cry for help so they can help defuse the situation discretely and without fuss.
attributes.additional_details:
A woman has successfully used the ‘Ask for Angela’ safety scheme to remove herself from a difficult situation during a night out.

A number of pubs across the country offer the scheme, which aims to reduce sexual violence and vulnerability by providing men and women with a subtle phrase they can use to get out of uncomfortable or potentially dangerous circumstances.

One pub in Gloucester successfully helped a female patron to do just that.

attributes.action: Create a new minimum wage called the Qualified minimum wage.
attributes.background: When a person is trained or qualified to do a job, they should automatically qualify for the qualified minimum wage (in line with the age group)  which is a higher rate to recognise the skill.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand that at the moment there is no national recognised wage for a qualified person. Therefore there is no incentive to invest in training or learning a trade. 
Weather you are a nurse, plumber, driver, dental nurse or brick layer. Skills should be recognised.

attributes.action: Automatically give custodial sentences to those who steal from vulnerable people
attributes.background: I would like the Government to change the law so that people who steal from vulnerable people when they are working in a position of trust are automatically given a custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Make it impossible to claim benefits totalling more than the minimum wage
attributes.background:
Nobody on benefits should be able to claim more money per month than a person working full time in a minimum wage job.

How do we expect people to find work if they would be worse off working than on benefits.

Exceptions to this rule should only be made to disabled and elderly people.

attributes.action: Make sending unsolicited pictures of penises illegal
attributes.background: Women are being sent many unwanted photographs of penises, it is just as distressing as in the flesh which is already covered by indecent exposure laws.
attributes.additional_details: We need everyone to know that an unwanted penis is unwanted whether it is in the flesh or in a photograph. You should have a communication trail to prove it was wanted.

attributes.action: Ban betting adverts on all TV channels before watershed
attributes.background: Gambling and betting are now well known addictions that are damaging to health, way of life, and destroy relationships and families.

attributes.action: Include Paediatric First Aid Training in the ante-natal classes for new parents
attributes.background: There have been many situations where trained parents have saved their babies life but there’s also one to many cases where a baby has been lost because parents were lost in despair not knowing to take action. Knowing CPR is critical and all new parents should know how to save the baby if needed be.
attributes.additional_details: Many parents have taken their sad stories to social media to warn other parents of potential risks and advised them to take a CPR course

attributes.action: Increase Funding for Existing Youth Clubs and Open New Youth Clubs Across the UK
attributes.background: Violent crime has increased across the UK for reasons that trace back to a lack of funding. There are less places for our youth to go and socialise with people their own age in a controlled safe environment outside school hours in deprived areas. The boredom and distrust has encouraged more violence

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for 2 people to travel on a Moped.
attributes.background:
I want to change the law to stop 2 people travelling on a Moped. 
The reason for this is to stop Criminal Offences including Acid attacks, Mobile phone snatching, Handbag snatching etc...
This will not affect Motorbike riders.
attributes.additional_details:
As we have seen on the News headlines these crimes are often carried out by 2 people on a Moped where the passenger is spraying Acid or snatching personal items from pedestrians. This will allow the Police to stop, search and charge these criminals before they commit these serious offences.
This Law will not affect Motorbike riders who are generally older and using Motorbikes for genuine travelling.

attributes.action: Animal abuse charges to be the same as human abuse charges
attributes.background: Murder is murder, assault is assault, physical abuse is physical abuse whether it is a human or an animal anyone found murdering or assaulting an animal should be punished the same as if they had murdered/assaulted a human to the maximum extent of the law.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of animals are killed murdered, brutally beaten, or left to starve to death. The sentencing for these offences is often a minimum Unlimited fine and/or 6 months. Help to stop animal suffering by signing our petition. 

Examples: - 
http://www.da4a.org/sport.htm
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/katy-gammon-solicitor-who-locked-3391542
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/donald-trumps-son-game-hunting-photos/

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory labelling for meat from animals reared with antibiotics.
attributes.background: Increasing bacterial antibiotic resistance is "one of the biggest threats to global health" (WHO). Agricultural use of antibiotics in the UK is decreasing (UK-VARSS), but knowledge of the threat to public health is limited. Labelling would increase knowledge and encourage consumer choice.
attributes.additional_details:
Awareness of the threat of antibiotic resistance is increasing. Public health measures to deal with it have focussed on correct use and prescription of therapeutic antibiotics. However, there is less knowledge of the threat posed by veterinary antibiotics.

A food labelling regime would raise awareness of this issue, and support the ongoing aim of reducing use. It also informs consumers about agricultural practice on imported food, which will be more important after Brexit.

attributes.action: End the inequality of Child Tax Credits and Child Benefit after a separation.
attributes.background: After a separation a "non-resident" parent with shared 50/50 caring is not entitled to claim Child Tax Credits easily and fairly under the current system. This is causing children to live half their lives in poverty.
attributes.additional_details: When a child is born 1 parent claims the Child Benefit. At the direct time of separation in a 50/50% contact scenario only the "resident parent" can claim the Child Tax Credit benefit due to being in receipt of the Child Benefit. End the inequality! Non-resident parents and children deserve a fairer system.

attributes.action: Examine the entire policing operation in the UK.
attributes.background: Policing has moved on. Crime is again predominating. Policing is asked to do more with ever decreasing numbers of officers. Yet the only section of the police family that is suffering is the front line. A fundamental change is needed.
attributes.additional_details: There is no longer justification for 43 constabularies with all the expenditure associated with them. We need a major re-think. Budget saved would be used to increase front line officers delivering policingthe through a streamlined, efficient leadership model. Supported financially by the sale of headquarters buildings the service can become more visual as should be the case. The knock on effect would also mean the reduction of Crime Commissioners and their entourage within a refirmed structure.

attributes.action: To make parole board members directly culpable for the actions of those released
attributes.background: A new law is required. Parole board experts release convicts who then go on to re-offend. The public get assaulted and maimed, the experts on the parole board hide in their anonymity. If a convict is paroled and murders, then every member of that board should serve the sentence with their convict.
attributes.additional_details:
Parole boards are only accountable to themselves, not to the public. One of these is about to release "The Black Cab Rapist" after 10 years of an indeterminate sentence. This could make the public unsafe.
 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-42571219

attributes.action: Fund free vet care for people who can't afford it
attributes.background: I feel that hospitals are charging people a lot of money for pet care, some people can't afford. I lost my beloved pet who I consider to be my child because of the high costs of treatment.
attributes.additional_details: My pet was suffering from meningitis.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for local councils to scan deceased domestic animals
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for local councils to scan deceased domestic animals for chips and report to local vet to alert owners, to ensure people are aware their pet has passed away and don’t continue looking, also to raise awareness of potential animal abuse in certain boroughs
attributes.additional_details: Local council are collecting cats and dogs found and just disposing of them with other waste without any form of logging system this leads to people often looking for pets months and even years putting up flyers for animals they have no hope of finding. To support people and boroughs in identifying potential animal cruelty occurring within a borough who has excessive number of missing domesticated pets

attributes.action: Cap Insurance Prices For People Under 25.
attributes.background: Insurance prices for young drivers is too high, often being in the thousands for a car that will only cost a few hundred pounds. Similar petitions have been started in the past but this one is different as I propose that a power cap is put on cars.
attributes.additional_details: My idea is to introduce a similar system to motorcycles and limit the power of cars young people can drive for 3 years after passing their test. A limit of 1600cc, this lowers the power that a young driver can have therefore meaning that they cannot have a car that is too powerful for them to control, insurance companies can then cap out insurance making it lower for all people as there are less powerful cars being driven by young drivers, making the roads safer for everyone in turn too.

attributes.action: Guard those with health problems from malicious messages (epilepsy/ strobe GIFs)
attributes.background: People with health conditions have to take precaution in everyday life, however, if they are specifically targeted via social media or message then there is nothing place to protect them against this. We, the undersigned, call on the Houses of Parliament to review this and make necessary changes.
attributes.additional_details: On 5th February 2018, a person posted a Strobe GIF to an epilepsy group leaving several people ill and one in hospital. Her profile states that she is based in the UK. People in the UK have been to the police regarding this. The police have wanted to do something about this but current UK legislation does not cover this, it does not even fall under "malicious communication".

attributes.action: Save the Streetlighting on the A2 between Bexley and Dartford
attributes.background: The streetlights on this section of the A2 have recently been switched off. On further investigation it appears Highways England are to remove the lighting columns as they are life expired. This is ridiculous and a dangerous decision on such a busy road. Please help me to get the decision reversed.
attributes.additional_details: I spoke to a Highways England who confirmed that they were being removed. Only to tell me that the white lines would be refreshed as if that would suffice!

attributes.action: Create"National Unity Day" UK-wide bank holiday to celebrate all that unites us.
attributes.background: We believe the United Kingdom needs a day that celebrates and promotes the fabric of what our great country was built upon - Unity. With our nation more divided than ever, we need a day that will bring us together to celebrate all that we have in common.
attributes.additional_details:
For more details visit:
www.Diversify.org

attributes.action: Veterinary surgeons from outside the UK sit the statutory MRCVS examinations.
attributes.background: Non EU veterinary surgeon have to sit the MRCVS examinations some of them from more medically advanced countries than the UK. EU vets don’t have to sit this exam, but should, it would standardise the level of competency in veterinary surgeons allowed to practice in the UK.

attributes.action: Mandatory for all hospital theatres to evacuate diathermy  tissue smoke plume.
attributes.background: Despite having risk assessments,some surgeons are reluctant to use smoke evacuation, which puts perioperative staff and patients at a risk of breathing in harmful diathermy tissue smoke.
attributes.additional_details:
Diathermy smoke called plaque, is also carcinogenic and mutagenic and even contains hydrogen cyanide.One gram of diathermy tissue is equal to smoking six (6) unfiltered cigarettes.

I want the government to make diathermy smoke evacuation a compulsory requirement rather than a recommendation.

http://ortoday.com/the-real-risks-surgical-smoke/

attributes.action: Ban the delivery of charity collection bags to households in the UK
attributes.background: Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes, are delivered to thousands of households in the UK every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending up straight in the homeowner’s bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes, are delivered to thousands of households in the UK every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending up straight in the homeowner’s bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.

It is believed that 500,000 plastic charity collection bags are sent to landfill every year. Each bag is delivered inside another plastic bag envelope, so about one million bags are disposed of every year. 

Charities rely on the donation of goods. Unwanted goods can be taken to local charity shops or conveniently located collection points. 

If you agree, please sign and share.

attributes.action: Stop disabled  badge users parking on double yellows
attributes.background: Stop disabled badge users parking on double yellows and causing an obstruction to service, delivery and emergency service vehicles

attributes.action: To facilitate doctors entry into the Obs & Gyn training at ST3+ level
attributes.background: Non trainee doctors, contribute significantly to the provision of healthcare in the NHS. They are often overlooked when it comes to training opportunities, therefore unable to progress in their careers and are left disillusioned, frustrated and disappointed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently many specialities allow entry to the training at middle grade (ST3+level) except in speciality of Obstetrics and Gynaecology, which only allows entry at ST1 level.
Although there is a noticeable dropout rate of 40% of the trainees from ST1 level onwards, which impacts on the middle grade rota, as there is no recruitment for the trainees at this level, this has created significant difficulties in providing safe Obs and Gyn services. We request that the RCOG and Department of Health to create ST3+ level entry for training in Obs and Gyn . This will help to cover the middle grade rota gaps thus ensuring safe obstetric service in UK and allow  Non training grade doctors to fulfil their career ambitions. Overall, this will prevent the loss of highly skilled doctors from the NHS.

attributes.action: UK government to recognise East Jerusalem as the capital of Palestine.
attributes.background: In response to the action taken by the US president Donald Trump the UK government should recognise East Jerusalem as the capital of Palestine. This would help with the 2 state peace solution and take away the negativity of the actions taken by the USA.

attributes.action: People Aid - govt pays your share of overseas aid to the charity you choose
attributes.background: Imagine you decide each year which UK charity/ies should be paid £300 (your share of the overseas aid). It could be a UK charity supporting foreign aid as at present or you may feel it would be better spent at home e.g. on a hospice, the local secondary school, animal welfare, medical research, etc.
attributes.additional_details: The aid budget will be about £14 billion a year over the next 5 years and there are about 48 million people on the electoral register for local elections. That's £300 per person per year. There are about 170,000 UK charities supporting both UK and foreign good causes. Examples - 1000 supporters of a local hospice or school could direct £1.5m goes there over 5 years; or through your local church 100 people decide to commit to a medical facility eradicating AIDS in Africa - that's £30,000 per year

attributes.action: Advise the Queen to make the London Borough of Richmond a Royal Borough
attributes.background: Richmond has two existing Royal Palaces (Hampton Court & Kew Palace) and a rich history of Royal connections, patronage and places. No borough deserves Royal status more than Richmond.
attributes.additional_details: I wrote to the Secretary of State few years ago asking for Royal Borough status for Richmond and it was politely declined in favour of Greenwich. It's time to ask again via this petition.

attributes.action: A wider range of physical education must be taught in schools
attributes.background: The government has been encouraging sport to combat obesity for years but if children do not enjoy the sports which they are taught then they may decide that they do not enjoy sport at all and refrain from exercising in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the law dictates that children must be taught athletics, dance, gymnastics, swimming and games but there is no specific rules about which 'games' must be played.

If children are given a more extensive range of sports, such as water polo, they may find a passion for sport that they would never have discovered otherwise.

attributes.action: scrap 'smart' motorways and revert to a hard shoulder
attributes.background: So called 'smart' motorways are anything but smart . A small refuge that can barely accommodate an HGV . Cars do not breakdown always where there is a refuge available . There is no facility for cars/lorries to re-join at motorway speed . Cars breaking down in the 4th lane are sitting ducks .
